title: Naturalistic Teaching Case Study 1
citation: Author et al. (2020). Naturalistic Teaching intervention study. Behavior Analysis in Practice, 40(1), 100-120.

functionalAnalysis.conclusion: Clear escape function identified with experimental control demonstrated

procedure: Generalization programmed across settings and people

results.quantitativeData: Naturalistic Teaching resulted in 75% reduction in problem behavior over 4 weeks. Baseline: 15 instances per session. Post-intervention: 2 instances per session.
results.maintenanceData: 1-month follow-up: Behavior remained at low levels (1-3 per session)
results.socialValidity: Teachers rated intervention as highly effective (4.2/5.0 average rating)

significance.theoretical: Demonstrated Naturalistic Teaching principles in applied setting with rigorous experimental design
significance.clinical: Naturalistic Teaching shown effective for severe problem behavior across diverse populations
significance.impact: Study contributes to evidence base for Naturalistic Teaching as scientifically supported intervention

examRelevance: Demonstrates Naturalistic Teaching procedures aligned with BACB Task List. Shows application of functional assessment principles.

accessInfo.note: Freely available through PubMed Central or journal website
